resources.string: …BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT/6 PM MDT/ THURSDAY… * WHAT…Heavy snow and blizzard conditions. Visibilities below ¼ mile. Storm total snow between 15 and 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph with extensive blowing and drifting snow. Snow drifts as deep as 6 feet. * WHERE…Portions of northwest and central North Dakota. * WHEN…Until 7 PM CDT/6 PM MDT/ Thursday. * IMPACTS…Travel nearly impossible. Some tree limbs may be broken. Some power outages possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS… Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. Notify a friend or family member of your travel plans. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Check the North Dakota Department of Transportation road report!
